listing.notes:
Spieleranzahl: 3 bis 5 Spieldauer: 30 Minuten Altersempfehlung: 10+
ORACLE - Erfülle dein Orakel und mache den besten Stich! Dann glänzt du um am Ende als Held in einem antiken Epos mit Hydra, Pegasus und Phönix!
Oracle ist ein trickreiches Kartenspiel für 3-5 Mitspieler ab 10 Jahren von Stefan Dorra. Mach zur richtigen Zeit den richtigen Stich, um Punkte zu sammeln. Aber Vorsicht: bei falschem Timing werden dir wichtige Punkte abgezogen, die dich am Ende den Sieg kosten können! Zusätzliche Orakelkarten ermöglichen es dir Sonderpunkte zu erzielen, wenn du eine bestimmte Aufgabe erfüllst. Außerdem gilt die „1 schlägt 12-Regel“, wodurch der eigentliche Kartenwert bei bestimmten Stichen auf den Kopf gestellt wird.
Untermalt wird dieses muntere Stichspiel durch die Illustration von Christian Opperer, der sich der griechischen Mytologie bedient, um die Karten passend zum Thema Oracle in Szene zusetzen. So stechen bei diesem Spiel nicht Kreuz, Pik und Herz, stattdessen kommt es zu einem epischen Abenteuer mit Hydra, Pegasus und Phönix…
Inhalt: 60 Karten 40 Orakelkarten 16 Aufkleber 16 Holzscheiben 5 Übersichtskarten 1 Wertungsblockng
https://youtu.be/iZUbrAw82Io
Mit Spielregeln in folgenden Sprachen: DE

boardgame.name: A Nagyi régi kredence: Bűvöletkártyák
The Whatnot Cabinet: Fascination Pack Mini-Expansion
boardgame.description:
The Fascination Pack Mini-Expansion is a hidden objective expansion given each player additional sets / combinations to chase after for victory points. The Fascination Pack gives players extra flexibility and creates new scoring opportunities as the game progresses.

All Kickstarter backers who pledge for The Whatnot Cabinet will also receive the Fascination Pack for FREE. This expansion will be available for sale separately on BGG, at Conventions, etc. Neither will be packaged within the base game.

boardgame.name: Speed Colors: Free Demo Version
boardgame.description:
A free promotional demonstration version of the game Speed Colors.

In Speed Colors, each player has a double-sided card with a colorful picture on one side and the same picture but in black and white on the other side. All players memorize the colorful side of their pictures, flip it, then color it in as quickly as possible the same way as on the back of the card! The faster and the more accurate you are, the more points you get. Try to keep up as the caps on the markers are switched at the end of each round (adding more challenge)!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Atelier
boardgame.description:
In Atelier, from 2 to 5 players play the role of painters that are called to create wonderful pieces of art.

On their turn, players have to decide whether to draw 2 cards from the center or play cards on their display. If they decide to play cards, they will have to pay the cost by discarding other cards from hand or using the colors from the palette. The cards played have a double function: on one side they form players' personal palette, on the other side they score points at the end of the game as works of art.

An important feature of the game is that cards must be played in a certain order. First players have to play the white canvas, then the white canvas can be drawn with a "drawing" card, finally the drawing card can be completed placing a painting card on it.

The first player who completes a work becomes the original painter while all the other players who complete the same work subsequently are considered counterfeiters.

The game ends when there are a certain number of finished paintings. Players earn points according to the works created and lose points for the canvases left blank. In addition to the canvas points, players can achieve goals during the game that provide extra points. The player with the most points will be elected the most renowned artist!

boardgame.name: Pollen!: The Card Game
boardgame.description:
Try to pollinate more fruit trees than your opponent with your bugs, always paying attention not to be shooed away!
In your turn put a BUG card under a tree to shoo away your opponent's and as soon as you reach 3 BUG, pollinate the tree! When you've pollinated three trees you'll win. Some other card could slow down your victory, don't lose heart!

—description from the designer

Con i tuoi insetti cerca di impollinare più alberi da frutto del tuo avversario facendo sempre attenzione a non farteli scacciare via!
Nel tuo turno gioca una carta INSETTO sotto ad un albero per scacciare quella avversaria, quando ne hai messe 3, impollina l' albero! Con 3 alberi impollinati hai vinto la partita! Qualche altra carta rallenterà la tua vittoria, ma non perderti d' animo!

Un gioco di carte 1 contro 1 veloce e divertente!

—description from the desinger (Italian)

boardgame.name: Les Petites Bourgades: Fortune – Cartes Promo 2019
Tiny Town: Játszóház és Reflexshop szaküzlet promókártyák
Tiny Towns: FLGS and Larkstone Promo Cards
Tiny Towns: Spellenwinkel & Herberg promokaarten
Tiny Towns: Spieleladen und Sprudelhof Promokarten

Two special promo cards for Tiny Towns!

Larkstone:
This Monument scores after all other scoring. Score points based on the number of players with more points than you.

2 = 5 points

4 = 8 points
5+ = 9 points

Friendly Local Game Store:

boardgame.name: A Ranger's Station
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A 5th Edition Mini-Dungeon for six characters of levels 4-5

A ranger’s station in life is irrelevant to those serving only the wilderness, be they former criminals, or hermits wishing to find peace and solitude in the bosom of mother nature. For ages, the rangers have served in the wilderness, sometimes banding together, but remaining mostly autonomous.

There was a time when fiercely independent rangers swore to fight as one. With the druids of the wildlands, they pushed back those callously clearcutting great swaths of forested land for temporary material gain, those in service of the heartless expansion of so-called civilization. The rangers’ mission to halt the relentless sprawl of the ever-voracious cities was a dream, but alas, proved to be just that - a dream, and in time, the alliance fell apart.

After decades in seclusion, Ishmael, the aging and dying leader of the rangers, calls one last time upon his erstwhile allies, to gather and defend the forests, issuing a rallying cry for the last battle of nature vs. civilization in this part of the world.

boardgame.name: A Tale of Two Liches
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A 5th Edition Mini-Dungeon for four to six characters of levels 11-14

A Tale of Two Liches takes place in an underground complex housing an inexhaustible supply of necrotic energy. Before lichdom, Pragnazok devised a way to fuse his essence with a golem, but the fusing would kill him unless he assumed lich form. The process also required tremendous amounts of necrotic energy. Pragnazok located a rift that provided the energy but was thwarted by the presence of a demilich that controlled the source. Seeking to usurp the demilich's control, Pragnazok attempted to wrest control of the power source, but something went wrong. The phylacteries of Pragnazok and the demilich became linked. While the demilich is corporeal, its phylactery cannot be destroyed without destroying Pragnazok’s. Pragnazok is trapped, unwilling to leave his phylactery at the mercy of the demilich.

boardgame.name: Dice Theme Park
boardgame.description:
Dice Theme Park is a dice manipulation board game, all about creating and running your own park of fairground attractions.

In Dice Theme Park, you are the park managers, trying to create the most successful theme park in the area, by getting your customers on the most rides possible! The dice in the game represent the customers, with hex tiles representing the rides in your park. Employing a unique “Dice-cascade” mechanic once a customer has enjoyed a ride, their dice value is reduced, but they can still continue to enjoy more rides in the theme park until their value drops to 0 where they exit. This means the more efficiently you can move your dice around to activate the most rewarding rides, the more points and money you receive!

Dice Theme Park also features a card based turn initiative mechanic, decided by your special action role cards (with values 1-6), with players selecting two cards each turn. The lowest total will gain first choice of the customer dice draft and ride tiles that round. At the end of the round those cards will then be passed to the player on your left.

Dice Theme Park is more interactive and slightly more complex than Dice Hospital, so it’s perfect for those looking for a more challenging experience with more ways to score and play, whilst still keeping that same engaging and satisfying feel every time it is played.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: PSYCLE
サイクル
boardgame.description:
サイクル (PSYCLE) is a psychological card game from Japan. Players try to win rounds by playing their higher value cards. But the lower cards are cheaper to get, and give more victory points. Can players out-think their opponents and win rounds at lower cost?

The cards have numbers and stars; high cards have few stars, low cards have more stars. Players each choose a card in secret and then reveal them. Mostly, the highest number will win the round, but some low cards will beat a higher value (so a 1 beats a 0 and a 5). Hence, the round has a rock-scissors-paper resolution.

The winning card gets points by multiplying the card's stars by the number of players beaten. So a high card might win, but not get many points. If a player can win with a low card, they gain a much higher score.

Players can also collect resource tokens (spent by playing some cards), and win bonus tiles from the centre. The game turns on being able to predict what other players will do, and maximise your scoring by winning with a low card, or collecting bonuses when you can't win.

The game comes with JPN/ENG rules.

boardgame.name: Viking Adventures
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

It’s time to go a Viking!

The original Frost & Fur for the 3.5 Edition featured four different cultures; this update for 5E converts and massively expands the information on Nordic myth.

This campaign setting features five new subspecies; 12 new subclasses; 22 new spells; 38 runes for use with the new runecasting rules; 25 herbs for use with the new herbalism rules; over 30 arms, armor, vehicles, and other equipment; rules for governing one’s personal honor (hamingja); nine places of existence; nearly 40 deities; and over 40 new monsters.

So grab your bryntroll, don your byrnie, and prepare yourself for a battle that will surely earn you a place in Valhalla. Viking Adventures await!

boardgame.name: Itinerarium Imperii: The Empire and Its Roads
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

"Then Romulus shall receive the sceptre of his race, and found the walls of Mars, and call the people Romans. I have given no limits or duration to their possessions: I've given them empire without end."
Virgil, Aeneid

Historical-Fantasy Roleplaying in a Roman Empire That Never Fell

ITINERARIUM IMPERII is an abstract of the Encyclopaedia Arcana, the definitive Lex Arcana setting compendium, with lots of ideas and game hooks for players and demiurges.

This sample chapter provides a lot of contents about the roman roads and several little scenarios to liven up your journey across the Roman empire!

The Encyclopaedia Arcana is the shortest path to bring your adventures to a whole new level of detail, for the glory of Rome and our Empire without end!

The Codex of the Dead is the first in a series of fantasy/horror creatures designed for use with Savage Worlds Adventure Edition. You get a new creature with full game statistics, along with a few adventure seed ideas for putting this fantastic fiend to work in your game.

Each edition will cost .... you guessed it ... 50 cents.

Codex of the Dead: an erudite new fiend and three adventure seeds for 50¢

Adventure Seeds
Evil Death Cult

boardgame.name: Rave of the Dead (M&M3)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Two great tastes that go great together: Superheroes and Zombies?

Graveyards and zombies seem an odd fit for the spandex set - but zombies are literally everywhere these days and it's something that's come up more and more frequently in superhero comics (Marvel Zombies and Blackest Night are the two most high profile examples.)

Genre debates aside, the bottom line is: fighting zombies is fun

In this adventure, the heroes are called upon to stop a B-list supervillain (Baron Bloodthane) from raising an army of the dead with an arcane ritual.

boardgame.name: Freedom Five: A Sentinel Comics Board Game
boardgame.description:
Freedom Five: A Sentinel Comics Board Game is a co-operative strategy game in which 1- 5 heroes race to protect their home city and its inhabitants from an onslaught of villainy from Baron Blade and his criminal cohorts. Each player must master their character's unique abilities to manage multiple crises throughout the city of Megalopolis. Assemble your friends to face standalone challenges, or mix it up and adventure through a series of campaign comics in which you will gain rewards ⁠— and new threats ⁠— each session.

Immerse yourself in the world of Sentinel Comics and test your wits against a dastardly smart "A.I." in the newest evolution of the Defenders of the Realm series by Richard Launius.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: First Responders (Fate)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Super Conflict Rages and You're Caught in the Middle!

You're not a superhero but you're still a damn hero. You work for S.E.R.T., the Supers Emergency Response Team. Your job takes you into battlefields of superpowered juggernauts who don't realize the damage their battles cause and the lives they endanger. Evacuate trapped civilians, mark off those who can't be saved, avoid villains and minions, and get out safely.

This One Sheet adventure is designed for use with FATE Core and places characters into the role of emergency responders tasked with saving civilians caught in the crossfire of a battle between superheroes and supervillains. It features several random generators that make each playthrough different! You can even turn this one piece of paper into a small campaign. It's also great for single session on nights where someone can't make it or for convention play!

boardgame.name: Starport Scum
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Starport Scum is a tabletop game of fierce space adventure, space pirates and salvage crews looking for the next big break.

Drawing on sources such as Traveller, Firefly, Trigun and Borderlands, it's a game about getting by on the outskirts of civilization, always on the look out for that next job.

Combining miniatures war gaming with role playing game touches, Starport Scum is playable as a conventional miniatures game, a narrative RPG or a hybrid beast combining the best of both worlds.

From the introduction:

Starport Scum is a set of story-driven rules for miniatures games with a heavy role playing element.

What does that mean? It means it incorporates elements of both role playing games and war games, though it leans heavier on the latter.

Whereas a traditional RPG tends to use combat scenes to support the story, we tend to view it the opposite way around: The story is here to support fun miniatures combat scenarios.

boardgame.name: Bills to Pay, New Jobs & Money Making Schemes for Starport Scum
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This supplement introduces 4 new Job types to the Starport Scum system, expanding the range of options you have when setting up a randomly generated mission.

boardgame.name: Gun Runners Guide to Starport Scum
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

In this, you will find guns, lots of guns. Enough to get the Imperial Authorities quite interested, in fact.

boardgame.name: 1718: Death of a King – Swedish invasion of Norway in 1718
boardgame.description:
1718: Death of a King is the second game in The Scandinavian Wars Trilogy from Pantero Games. The game is a strategic level analysis of the invasions in 1716 and 1718, with units being battalions and regiments, with a few squadrons of cavalry and dragoons thrown in. The game will use the same basic set of rules as the other games* in the series and also has a few separate rules to account for the time period and way of war in the early 1700's. The map depicts the border area in southern Norway and Sweden, from Trondheim to Gothenburg.

As the Swedish player your goal is to force a Norwegian surrender by capturing Christiania (modern-day Oslo) and at least two major fortresses. And keep your King alive,of course. As the Norwegian player, your goal is to force the Swedes to retreat back into Sweden defeating units, destroying supplies and, if you are lucky, kill King Charles XII.

boardgame.name: TIMETRAP
タイムトラップ
boardgame.description:
タイムトラップ (TIMETRAP) is a card game from Japan.

In the year 2X77, humans have developed a time machine that can travel to the distant past for seven days. However, the past environment was terrifyingly harsh for those who went back in time. The physical phenomena in the surroundings are not stable, and it is necessary to keep the time machine running in order to keep the existence of the time traveler stable.

If the time machine stops, the existence of the time traveler disappears into emptiness. If you can safely reach the seventh day, you can return to the future. Return earlier than anyone else and share the experience with the world!

『2X77年』人類は遠い過去の7日間を旅する事が出来るタイムマシンを開発した。しかし、時を遡り過去に戻った者にとって過去の環境は恐ろしく過酷だった。周囲の物理現象は安定せず、タイムトラベラーの存在を安定的に存続させる為にはタイムマシンを稼働させ続ける必要がある。もしタイムマシンが停止したなら、タイムトラベラーの存在は『虚無』へと消える。 無事に7日目を迎えることが出来れば、未来へ帰還が可能だ。誰よりも早く帰還し、その経験を世界に伝えよ！

boardgame.name: Burtošanas čempionāts
boardgame.description:
Burtošanas čempionāts is a creative and educational board game for the family. A game that will expand your vocabulary and bring out even forgotten words from the depths of your mind. The aim is to create Latvian words from the most valuable syllables, thus accumulating as many points as possible.
On each card, there is one syllable that, when put together during the game, forms words. The rarer the syllable used, the more valuable the word is created. Each syllable has been assigned points depending on the frequency of use of syllables in Latvian. With this game you can make more than 2000 words. These include nouns, verbs, adjectives and adverbs. Words can be formed in basic forms and inflections - either. They can be both serious and a little unserious.

boardgame.name: AFFINITY
アフィニティー
boardgame.description:
アフィニティー (AFFINITY) is a game of fantasy medieval war and politics, from Japan. Players build up armies to fight for the kingdom, using bluffing and bargaining. Using psychology to out-think the opponents is needed, as the ending is never certain.

After a long war, the feudal system has declined, and leading aristocrats began to fight for the right to inherit the throne. Soldiers engage in combat seeking specific rewards.

Practical rewards often cause betrayal and secession and end the era of loyalty and justice. In such an era, you must become one of the leading aristocracy. Form an army stronger than anyone in an arms race, for the war will bring in troops and mercenaries owned by other aristocrats.

Only players can see their units targeted for the competition, so it is fun to have a psychological battle with such bluffing or bargaining. Without knowing the enmey well enough, players cannot forecast the winner.
user summary

長く続いた戦乱の末に封建制度は衰退し、有力貴族は王位継承権を巡る争いを始める。兵は報酬など具体的な見返りを基に戦役従事する事となった。実利的な見返りは裏切りや離反を多発させ忠誠と正義の時代は終わりを告げる。そんな時代の最中、あなたは有力貴族の一人となって、他の貴族が所有する部隊や傭兵を抱き込み来る戦争の為に軍拡競争をして、だれよりも強力な軍隊を編成しなくはなりません。

・競の対象となる部隊は親のみが見る事が出来るのでブラフや駆け引きといった心理戦が行われる所が楽しい。

・最後まで競り取った部隊の内容が見れないので最後まで勝者がわからない。

・手札の報酬カードには競りで有利になる能力がある物もある為、手札の中で自分なりの戦略を構築するのが楽しい。

・部隊を集め軍隊をコレクションしている感じが楽しい。
publisher's summary

boardgame.name: Wet Grandpa
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Wet Grandpa don't care to say much, but his brain is always running. (It was that way before, too). Mostly now it plays back his wife's freshly dead eyes and his own terrible drowning. Sadness and fear haunt his living corpse. In his dreams he reaches out and the water listens. In dreams (and unexamined thoughts) he needs others to be like him. And so the river thrashes landward.

Wet Grandpa is system neutral/D20 agnostic adventure for however many players you can gather together. In it they will seek dubious treasure, find a village on its last legs, and possibly avert a quite unnatural disaster.

boardgame.name: Den of the Deceased Druids
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A 5th Edition Mini-Dungeon for six characters of levels 5-6

As the story goes, Greenleaf and Thium of Perenna, two women, were once ostracized from their community for the sole reason that they loved one another. They had nowhere to go and thus made a home together deep in the wilderness, for the trees and animals did not judge them or their love. Over the years, the two women became enamored with the ways of the natural world and adopted an awe-inspiring swath of land known for its great natural beauty and unique flora & fauna. They cared for and protected the land like one would a child, for nature cannot always defend itself from the evil machinations of humanoidkind.

In time, the lovers became powerful druids and befriended “Old Witherwood”, the largest treant in all the known world. Years passed, then decades. Time after time, the courageous druids drove off orcish axes and would-be invaders. During one incursion, Beldrek the Minotaur, wielding the fabled lance of lightning, joined them, first in battle, then in friendship.

As the women grew old and grey, their ability to care for and protect the lands as they once did, decreased. One day, Thium passed on and soon after, Greenleaf died from a broken heart. Witherwood opened the earth, revealing an ancient den, ordering Beldrek to craft a crypt suitable for the heroines’ burial. Beldrek took his task quite seriously and dedicated the rest of his life to building a crypt befitting of these legends. The crypt stands undisturbed, and only those deemed worthy by Witherwood are permitted entry.

boardgame.name: M-SPACE Companion
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

MAN OR MACHINE?

Tell new intriguing science fiction stories with M-SPACE Companion.

Create sidekick droids and AI villains with rules for robots and artificial intelligence. Or play as a robot.

Make powerful characters with the latest cybernetic implants. And try the cutting-edge Q Tech implants, bordering on magic.

Learn about your characters’ former lives in the Origins chapter, or breach security with the new rules for hacking.

A failed cybernetic experiment hides behind the blast doors at the bottom of a mineshaft. Find out more in the scenario Escape on Mosek Uhn.

This is what you get:

Rules for modular robots, both humanoid and simple droids.
Cybernetics, with implants and body part replacements.
The almost magical Q Tech implants.
Rules for detailed character backgrounds.
Computers and hacking.
Scenario: Escape From Mosek-Uhn.
Updated character sheet.

boardgame.name: Chronicles of Darkness: Dark Eras - Changeling: The Lost
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Chronicles of Darkness stories stretch back to the beginning of human civilization — and perhaps further. The Chronicles of Darkness: Dark Eras collections reveal the world throughout its long and storied past.

Now you can get all of the Changeling: The Lost Dark Eras originally published in Chronicles of Darkness: Dark Eras, the Dark Eras Companion, and Dark Eras 2 in a single Changeling: The Lost compilation.

Featured in this compilation are:

The Seven Wonders (CTL 2)
Three Kingdoms of Darkness (CTL 1)
Arthur’s Britannia (CTL 2)
Requiem for Regina (CTL 1)
Lily, Sabre, and Thorn (CTL 1)
A Grimm Dark Era (CTL 1)
Mysterious Frontiers (CTL 2)

boardgame.name: I Am Death Now?
boardgame.description:
Welcome to I Am Death Now?

You are Student Deaths trying to earn your official Death License. This is your Death Certification Examination(DCE).
To pass the DCE you must successfully kill your five Test Subjects* before the rest of your Classmates. In order to kill your Test Subjects, you must collect cards from the Pain Deck and play them on top of each Test Subject. Kill all five before everyone else and you earn your Death License.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Micro Chapbook Sci-Fi RPG Deluxe Core Rulebook
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This Deluxe Edition Core Rulebook also contains all the rules you need to play the game plus a few additions.

The Micro Chapbook Sci-Fi RPG system is an ultra simple roleplaying game that can be played solo or with a traditional GM if you so wish.

The main game focuses on solitaire gameplay, starring a single interplanetary explorer on missions for the Galactic Space Force. It uses randomly generated scenarios to make each game session a little different. This book also includes a random mission generator.

The universe for this game is brutal, unforgiving, and dark. Expect to die and die often.

This book includes an "Away Mission Generator" allowing you to create a new scenario each time you play.

boardgame.name: After School Ghost Club
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

When the Ghost Club dares you to go into the abandoned school, you accept. After all, as a member of the Ghost Club yourself you don’t want to look like a coward. So, after stepping through the front doors, you quickly realize you’re locked inside! It seems the only way to get the doors open again is to capture the ghosts whose energy is keeping them shut!

One player takes the role of the student while the other takes the role of the ghosts. The goal is different for both. The student is trying to escape the school after capturing enough ghosts. The Ghost is trying to reduce the Student to 0 Health or bar them from ever escaping the school again!

Perfect for fans of horror anime and games such as Corpse Party, Fatale Frame, Ghost Hunt, and more!

boardgame.name: Animal Companions
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

What is Animal Companions? It is a supplement for the Micro Chapbook RPG system that offers extra rules for adding Animal Companions to your game. Never enter a dungeon alone. Bring your trusty furry or feathery companion along with you!

boardgame.name: Book of Air Magic
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Tired of always swinging with a sword? Is beheading enemies with an ax not your thing? Why not learn some magic instead? The power of air blows through you!

The Book of Air Magic is ultra-simple rules for adding Air magic into any of your Micro Chapbook RPG games. Any character class may use the Book of Air Magic but Wizards get special bonuses!

boardgame.name: Book of Earth Magic
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Tired of always swinging with a sword? Is beheading enemies with an ax not your thing? Why not learn some magic instead? The power of earth resides within you!

The Book of Earth Magic is ultra-simple rules for adding earth magic into any of your Micro Chapbook RPG games. Any character class may use the Book of Earth Magic but Wizards get special bonuses!

boardgame.name: Book of Fire Magic
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Tired of always swinging with a sword? Is beheading enemies with an ax not your thing? Why not learn some magic instead? The ethereal flame burns within you!

The Book of Fire Magic is ultra-simple rules for adding fire magic into any of your Micro Chapbook RPG games. Any character class may use the Book of Fire Magic but Wizards get special bonuses!

boardgame.name: Book of Water Magic
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Tired of always swinging with a sword? Is beheading enemies with an ax not your thing? Why not learn some magic instead? The wave of water flows within you!

The Book of Water Magic is ultra-simple rules for adding water magic into any of your Micro Chapbook RPG games. Any character class may use the Book of Water Magic but Wizards get special bonuses!

boardgame.name: Looters of the Labyrinth
boardgame.description:
At last you've found it; a legendary and mysterious labyrinth, rumored to hold many treasures! Unfortunately, you're not alone; you've been followed by other treasure raiders, and you'll have to act quickly and shrewdly to secure the plunder for yourself.

OVERVIEW
This is a thematic abstract spatial strategy game for 2-8 players in which players place and demolish walls to be the first to reach the treasures in the center of the labyrinth.
It's recommended to play with 2-4 individual players or 2 teams of 2-4 players each. Game length scales by player count; roughly 15 minutes per player.

SETUP
The game is played on a square grid board, which is empty at setup except for 13 treasures near the center and player pawns adjacent to the corners. At the start of the game, players are dealt a hand of labyrinth wall cards which correspond to labyrinth wall pieces which are played on the board throughout the course of the game.

TURNS
Players take turns in clockwise order, choosing to perform one of four actions each turn; moving their player pawn, playing a labyrinth wall card to place a labyrinth wall on the board, weakening one of their own labyrinth walls on the board, or placing their rubble token on any labyrinth wall on the board.

MECHANICS
Pawns can only move orthogonally and can only stop when hitting either a labyrinth wall or the edge of the board, and pass through other pawns. Pawns collect treasure by moving through the treasure's square. Labyrinth walls are weakened whenever a pawn hits them, eventually being demolished instead and removed from the board. Players can only draw a new card when one of their labyrinth walls is removed from the board. Each player has only one rubble token; this can be played on any labyrinth wall on the board and acts as an open square, but must remain on that wall until the wall is demolished.

TEAM PLAY
Playing the game with two teams is the same as playing with individuals, except that collected treasure is pooled for each team on a team treasure board, and public table talk is typically allowed.

STRATEGY
Basic strategies involve placing labyrinth walls to either let your pawn stop in line with treasure, or to block other player's pawns. More advanced strategies include accomplishing both of the above with a single wall placement, using other player's constructions to your advantage, and placing walls to create an unblockable path to one or more treasures. Additionally, being careful to not run out of cards and using your rubble token wisely are both important.
The ability to visualize and plan potential routes and layouts is key to mastering the game's strategy. Team play brings even more strategic depth; teammates can help each other achieve goals and work together to thwart the competition.

GAME END
The game ends immediately once it is no longer possible for the player(s) with the fewest treasures to gain enough treasures to have the most treasures. The number of treasures needed to win per player count is specified in the instruction manual for clarity.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Blood for a Dollar
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This Deluxe Edition Core Rulebook brings the popular system to a Grim Wild West setting and is FULLY COMPATIBLE with all other Micro Chapbook RPG products. You can have a cowboy travel to the fantasy realm, or bring an elf to the old west. It is up to you.

This book includes all the rules for playing a character on the American Frontier. Fight against normal outlaws in shootouts or go up against supernatural creatures who lurk in the dark shadows of the western wilderness.

boardgame.name: Bug Ship: A Micro Chapbook RPG
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A derelict ship left floating in space. You fear it may be infested with a race of bug aliens who attach to a host ship and feed off the crew. Can you exterminate these bugs before they eat you?

Bug Ship is an ultra-simple science fiction roleplaying game where you explore a derelict ship. It can be played solo or with a traditional GM if you so wish. This game is based on the extremely popular grimdark fantasy Micro Chapbook RPG system.

These rules are specially designed for solo play on a grid map or graph paper but may also be used as quick and simple rules for a traditional GM run RPG game. Combine with other Micro Chapbook RPGs for extra options!

boardgame.name: Dwarven Talents
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Find the power of the axe!

Dwarven Talents is a Character Supplement for the Micro Chapbook RPG system and is usable by Dwarf characters. It adds depth to dwarf characters by providing new powerful abilities called Talents. It includes a progressive tree of talents for any dwarf character to use.

boardgame.name: Epic Wanderers
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

What is Epic Wanderers? It is an EPIC supplement for the Micro Chapbook RPG system. It offers extra rules add-ons and changes to help you create super powerful and heroic characters for the game system. This included higher starting stats, gold, health, and willpower. Additionally, each new race and class included has a special ability only they can use.

Tired of dying? Give an EPIC character a whirl.

boardgame.name: Explorers of the Realm
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

What is Explorers of the Realm? It is a sourcebook for use with any Micro Chapbook RPG System rulebook(s). It helps you create a randomly generated overworld map for your game in between dungeons and provides new rules for towns, churches, and companions. Much of the gameplay works in the same manner as described in any Micro Chapbook RPG book.

boardgame.name: Micro Chapbook RPG Deluxe Core Rulebook
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This Deluxe Edition Core Rulebook also contains all the rules you need to play the game plus a few additions. You’ll notice subtle differences here and there--but overall the game is the same one you’ve come to know and differences are noted in BOLD or with a Gameplay Note.

Even with the subtle differences, this book is completely compatible with ANY and ALL Chapbook Scenarios. In fact, this book includes an original Chapbook Scenario and Adventure Module to get you started. After that you can download any number of the free products in the Micro Chapbook line for further scenarios and adventures.

The Micro Chapbook RPG system is an ultra-simple roleplaying game that can be played solo or with a traditional GM if you so wish.

The main game focuses on solitaire gameplay, starring a single foolhardy hero. It uses randomly generated dungeon scenarios to make each game session a little different. This book also includes a premade adventure module.

The universe for this game is brutal, unforgiving, and dark. It takes notes from such classics as Dungeon Quest and Deathtrap Dungeon. Expect to die and die often.

boardgame.name: Aversion
boardgame.description:
The goal of the game is to find words that won't share any letter in the same position than the words previously found.

The winner is the player who made the most words, found the last one in the dictionnary or simply had the last word (others abandonned/couldn't play)

A scoring scheme can be used, for exemple 1 word/1 point, penalty for incorrect guesses. You can decide on a maximum alloted time for a move, play several rounds for a game to conclude, etc.


This is a pen and paper game. In the files section you'll find a small computer program with its source code that can serve as a referee.




—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Micro Chapbook RPG Deluxe Game Master's Guide
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This Deluxe Game Master’s Rulebook also contains the basic rules you need to play the game plus a few additions.

This book is completely compatible with ANY and ALL Chapbook Scenarios, and stands on its own, but is intended as a companion to the Deluxe Core Rulebook. While the Core Rulebook is focused on solo play the Game Master's Guide focuses on multiplayer--including with a GM and cooperative play without a GM.

In addition to rules, tips, and hints for Game Master’s, this book includes an original Chapbook Scenario and Adventure Module to get you started. After that you can download any number of the free products in the Micro Chapbook line for further scenarios and adventures.

boardgame.name: Micro Chapbook RPG Deluxe Scenario Collection
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This Deluxe Scenario Collection contains the absolute basic rules for you to play the game. It also includes the complete volume 1 of scenarios (collecting numbers 1 through 5 of the individually released Micro Chapbook) with a few updates.

Each scenario has been broken down into the following subsections for your convenience:


Backstory: A bit of background story to help get you into the experience.



Village Shop: A list of the weapons, armor, and items available in town.



Armory: Short descriptions of each weapon for added flavor and context.



Dungeon: The full complement of charts/tables needed for the scenario.



Bestiary: A short description of each monster found in the dungeon for added flavor and context.



Boss: A short description of the boss monster as well as the NEW REWARD you will earn for beating him (only found in this deluxe collection). You may earn this reward for each successful playthrough of a scenario.

boardgame.name: Table Air Combat: Ki-44 Tojo
boardgame.description:
Table Air Combat is a fast, simple air combat game that can be played on any flat surface.
All you need are some six-sided dice and some coins to provide weight for the aircraft counters.
Everything else can be printed from this ruleset.

Each player has a flight of four aircraft represented by two counters. Aircraft counters move by means of curved “performance rulers” that represent the aircraft’s historical cornering ability and maximum speed.

A performance ruler is unique to each aircraft, and contains all the speed, cornering, and weapon information needed.

TAC is designed for portability; The entire game can fit in a plastic bag.
Even the largest battles can take place on a fast-food restaurant table.

Ki-44 Shoki was a high-altitude interceptor with an excellent climb rate.
Self-sealing fuel tanks and a radial engine made it tough compared with other Japanese aircraft, but it suffered from weak armament of just four 12.7mm machine guns.

This set is a self-contained rulebook with miniatures for the Ki-44 Tojo and three scenarios that reference other aircraft.


Sho-Go: US Navy attacks Japanese-held airfield on Formosa island. Ki-44s defend against F6F Hellcat fighter-bombers.
Meridian: Royal Navy Hellcats and Avengers attack Japanese oil refineries in Sumatra. The Japanese Army Air Force defends with Ki-44s
Otsu: A variant of the Ki-44 uses 40mm cannons to intercept a formation of B-29 Superfortress bombers.


This set contains miniatures for the Ki-44.

Other aircraft must be purchased separately.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameintegration: Table Air Combat: Flight Operations Manual
Table Air Combat: Flight Operations Manual

boardgame.name: Micro Mutants RPG
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Welcome to the wasteland, the decaying remains of humanity. Cities, buildings, and streets are mere skeletons of what things used to be. Most humans are no longer... human. Instead, some strange virus - a direct result of nuclear testing in the New Mexico desert - has mutated most of mankind into misshapen beasts and flesh-hungry ghouls.

Humans aren’t the only ones affected. Animals, too, seem to have become distorted visages of themselves. Worse yet, new mutations, things undreamed of in man’s mind, now walk the earth - and no one knows where they came from.

You are one of the lucky (or perhaps unlucky) few who were not taken in the initial infections. Now barricaded in your own little hideaway in the food court of the Millenium Mall in the middle of New Mexico, you wait out the nights listening to the mutated damned wander and scratch through the halls and shops around you. During the day you wander out into the mall in search of supplies... and survival.

However, how long can you resist the infection that took the rest of humanity? How long can you stave off the hunger of the ghouls?

Only time will tell.

Welcome to the Millenium Mall.

boardgame.name: Mistress of Shadow
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A strange woman haunts the local cave in the woods. Some believe she is a ghost, others a witch, and others something far worse. Can you investigate and rid the town of fear?

Mistress of Shadow is a Micro Chapbook RPG--an ultra-light roleplaying game that fits in a single folded chapbook. Simply print off the two rules pages back-to-back, fold in half, and you have a completely playable Micro Chapbook RPG.

These rules are specially designed for solo play on a grid map or graph paper but may also be used as quick and simple rules for a traditional GM run RPG game. Combine with other Micro Chapbook RPGs for extra options!

boardgame.name: Factory 17: A New Location for Five Klicks From the Zone
boardgame.description:
The second supplement for Five Klicks adds a new location to explore: A monster infested factory full of toxic waste, genetic abnormalities and impenetrable gloom.

This location can be added to any on-going campaign and offers a somewhat tougher experience.

6 new enemies to fight, each with a special rule to make things interesting.
6 new "special conditions" to make the battle field a more dangerous or unpredictable place.
6 new items to acquire for your squad, 5 of them being unique and the last being a nice stash of things that go boom.


The location can be dropped into your existing campaign without having to restart and can be visited multiple times (6 in fact!).

You will need the main Five Klicks skirmish rules to use this pack.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Five Klicks From the Zone: Chapter 1 – Post collapse skirmish campaigns

boardgame.name: One Page Apocalypse Volume 1 - Christmas Fallout
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Welcome to One Page Apocalypse, a simple and easy role-playing-game for the solo player. You only need some printer paper, dice, and a pencil to play, making it perfect for a plane ride, hotel room, or anywhere else. The game works with a procedurally generated game map, adding some randomness to the game.

boardgame.name: One Page Asylum: Halloween Special 2019
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

What once was rain has turned to icy sleet, running down your cheeks, the back of your neck. Your hair is wet and sticks to your skin, chilling you further against the late October night. Your feet feel frozen standing in the cold mud of the woods. You know you need to find shelter quickly or you’ll certainly die of exposure. Unfortunately, your old clunker of a car broke down miles from the nearest town. Your only hope is to find an isolated farmhouse, barn, or some other building to spend the night and wait out the unexpected storm.

Marching through the woods, you make your way forward, the isolated road vanishing behind you through the thick trees. It feels as if you walk for hours. Your fingers go numb. Your feet burn. Your stomach grumbles for something to eat. Then you see it. Stepping out of the trees into a clearing, you are dwarfed by an enormous building. It looks like it was once a hospital of sorts . . . but now it is abandoned.

Gritting your teeth, you head for the door.

boardgame.name: Miskatonic Tunnels
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

It has always been rumored that there are tunnels running under the campus of Miskatonic University. Long have students and faculty alike speculated about the strange possibility that these tunnels exist--and yet no one has ever proven their existence. Many have speculated that the tunnels were originally built for use by the faculty more easily and quickly move about campus, but I hardly believe that to be true. Others think it is a remnant from the Civil War--something the south had dug. Again, I disagree. Further, students have whispered about a far more sinister origin for the tunnels.

This is the theory I agree with. My research and investigation into the case brings me to the conclusion that the tunnels were made like a labyrinth--something once used by a cult to summon and harness unimaginable horrors from another world. Now, it acts as a prison for those secrets. That is why I need you. I have found an old and incomplete blueprint which reveals the entrance to the tunnels.

That’s where you come in. I want you to go down and investigate, find clues to what happened there, and map out the tunnels for me.

boardgame.name: The Black Caverns
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

It seems I am forced, once again, to call upon you for your services. I hate to draw you away from the much-needed rest you are getting since our last encounter on the campus of Miskatonic University--but this is a matter of life and death.

I have it on good authority that something strange is happening over at The Black Caverns near the edge of town. I can hardly believe it myself, but it seems the same cult we faced previously is finding a new home in the labyrinth beneath Arkham. The information I’ve gathered is that they call themselves “The Blind Ones” and they prefer the dark and subterranean areas of Arkham. It is a well-known fact among the professors of geology here at the university that there are many varied tunnels and paths in those caves. Most agree that at least seventy-five percent of the underground system has gone unexplored . . . or at the very least undocumented. It would seem that most of those who’ve gone down there have never come back up. I hate to say it, but I believe they are being used in some sort of dark ritual. I beg you, go into those caverns, find the missing persons, and stop whatever horrific rituals are being performed.

boardgame.name: Night in Arkham Woods
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Since last we met, I’ve discovered something even worse than we ever imagined. The cult we pushed out of the Miskatonic University campus, the ones we thought we wiped out from the tunnels of the Black Cave, have found a new home in Arkham Woods. This time, they mean to complete their ritual and awaken the Ancient Ones they worship. “The Blind Ones,” as they called themselves, have recruited countless youth from around the town of Arkham with false promises of freedom and power. Instead, they are performing terrible rituals on them to turn them into twisted and lowly creatures of the night, creatures who are part animal with horns and fur, creatures who thirst to feast on human blood. The cult calls them the Children of the Goat. They are the unholy spawn of the Ancient God known as The Lord of the Wood.

I’m calling upon you this one final time to help me put a stop to this madness once and for all.

boardgame.name: Under the Frosty Inn
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Welcome to Frostmire, a frozen and harsh fantasy world where only the bravest (or perhaps foolhardy) heroes dare to venture. This chilling and somewhat dark realm is the setting for Season 2 of One Page Dungeon. Each volume will build upon the last, offering new snowy and frost-covered caverns and dungeons in each entry--along with new monsters, spells, and class options as well. Each entry stands alone, so no need to worry!

One Page Dungeon: Frostmire is a simple and easy role-playing-game for the solo player. You only need some printer paper, dice, and a pencil to play, making it perfect for a plane ride, hotel room, or anywhere else. The game works with a procedurally generated dungeon, adding some randomness to the game.

This newest volume marks the opening to Season 2 of the game--set in the chilly and dark world of Frostmire. This season takes all of the absolute basics introduced in Season 1 and builds upon them. Additionally, for those who played season 1, season 2 goes into greater detail on rules--helping to clarify gameplay even further. Enjoy!

boardgame.name: Holiday in Chillson Wood
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Welcome to One Page Dungeon: Frostmire, a simple and easy role-playing-game for the solo player. You only need some printer paper, dice, and a pencil to play, making it perfect for a plane ride, hotel room, or anywhere else. The game works with a procedurally generated dungeon, adding some randomness to the game. The second volume of the FrostMire season takes place during the Yuleton Celebration in Trillit, when the festivities are interrupted by packs of hungry wolves from the woods.

boardgame.name: Space Pirates
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A crew of Space Pirates have abducted a peaceful convoy ship transporting politicians. Can you board the ship and kill the Pirate King before it is too late?

Space Pirates is an ultra-simple science fiction roleplaying game where you explore a derelict ship. It can be played solo or with a traditional GM if you so wish. This game is based on the extremely popular grimdark fantasy Micro Chapbook RPG system.

These rules are specially designed for solo play on a grid map or graph paper but may also be used as quick and simple rules for a traditional GM run RPG game. Combine with other Micro Chapbook RPGs for extra options!

boardgame.name: Skeleton Waters
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

After clearing a nearby cavern of skeletons--and the evil necromancer who made them--you realize an underground river from that same cave leads further into the earth. Could some of the necromancer’s skeleton army have escaped?

Skeleton Waters is a mini-adventure module for the Micro Chapbook RPG and a companion to the Skeleton Cavern Chapbook. Simply print off the two rules pages back-to-back, fold in half, and you have a completely playable Mini Module.

boardgame.name: Railways of Sweden
boardgame.description:
Railway expansion to the north continues in Railways of Sweden, an expansion in the Railways of the World Series. From the mountainous north to the coastal ferries, building rail lines in Sweden can be costly. Only the Rail Baron with the most guile and economic prowess will be victorious in the end.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Summit
boardgame.description:
Summit is played on a 4x4 grid, although larger boards are suggested as a variant. Players take turns writing numbers in empty spaces; each player will end up writing the numbers from 1-8.

After all spaces are filled one player will score the rows and the other the columns; in each case the score is the absolute difference between the total and 18.

Symmetric play is prohibited by a rule requiring no diagonal symmetry after both players have taken three turns.

boardgame.name: Railways of Australia
boardgame.description:
In the late 19th century, railway expansion across Australia suffered from inconsistent rail gauges. This lack of planning meant that different rail gauges must meet up at a station for passengers and cargo to switch from one line to the next before continuing on their journey. Railways of Australia recreates this dilemma in a large scale map that is truly designed for 2-6 players.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Flat Plastic Miniatures - DM Starter
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Flat Plastic Miniatures - DM Starter Set is a curated bundle of 167 pieces from our entire collection of artwork. It includes 30 small, 10 wide, 100 medium, 15 large, and 12 giant pieces.

Flat Plastic Miniatures are printed on sturdy transparent plastic, with unique front and back art to indicate unit facing. Light, durable, pop in and out of bases easily and pack flat for transport or storage, FPMs make an ideal and affordable miniature.

Set includes 42 Round Bases (2x copies of the Round Supermix base panel)

boardgame.name: Spell Effects 2.0 - 5E Generic
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The “5E Generic” set contains EVERY spell size and shape, for every class. You will never need another set of Spell Effects! Fireball, Lightning Bolt, Web, Cone of Cold, Burning Hands, Fear, Dragon Breaths, Faerie Fire, Moonbeam, Tidal Wave, Wall of Fire, Thunderwave, buff tokens, inspiration tokens, monster summoning tokens and MUCH more.
...
Double-sided printing on transparent plastic, with graphics on one side, and helpful notes on the other to remind you of damage codes, saving throws, and other key details. Designed specifically for 5E, but with common shapes and sizes, this pack is a perfect addition for EVERY RPG!

This 3-page kit covers over 24 spell templates, dozens of buff and reference tokens, unit summoning tokens, and inspiration tokens. A fantastic aide for both player and GM.

boardgame.name: The Silver Bay Game
boardgame.description:
This family board game is about Silver Bay on Lake George and might just become your new favorite family game.

Players surround themselves with pine tree covered mountains and take the windy road through Silver Bay – a beautiful retreat on the Lake. They explore the lake, walk the labyrinth, visit the ice cream shop, all while gathering resources and trying not to get stranded on an island.

Objective: Visit as many destinations on the Silver Bay campus as you can and acquire them with your gathered resources (pine cones). The game is over when all the Destination cards are claimed. The Silver Bay Game could be the next best thing to actually being at the lake.

The game mixes both chance and strategy.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Flat Plastic Miniatures - Customs 01
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Flat Plastic Miniatures - Customs 1 is a 56-piece set of “Custom” user submissions collected during the Flat Plastic Miniatures 2 Kickstarter phase. It is filled with amazing new pieces, mostly fantasy with some sci fi, and other genres mixed in. It includes new races, new monsters, many custom PC options, and a few classic ‘things we missed’.

boardgame.name: Flat Plastic Miniatures - Customs 02
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Flat Plastic Miniatures - Customs 2 is a 64-piece set of “Custom” user submissions collected during the Flat Plastic Miniatures 2 Kickstarter phase. It is filled with amazing new pieces, mostly fantasy with some sci fi, and other genres mixed in. It includes new races, new monsters, many custom PC options, and a few classic ‘things we missed’.

boardgame.name: Flat Plastic Miniatures - Demonblood
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Flat Plastic Miniatures - Demonblood is a 62-piece pack reveling in the chaos and whimsy of demons in all forms. Brimming with PC and NPC Tieflings, demons, devils, fiends, creatures afflicted with demonic influences, and archetypes fitting the 7 deadly sins, along with some warlock familiars.

boardgame.name: Flat Plastic Miniatures - Cyberpunks
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Flat Plastic Miniatures - Cyberpunk is a 56-piece pack, dedicated to a wide variety of humanoids, cyber-enhanced humans, drones and vehicles. Themed for RPGs like Cyberpunk, Traveller, Shadowrun, and others.

boardgame.name: Flat Plastic Miniatures - Spacefarers
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Flat Plastic Miniatures - Spacefarers is a 56-piece pack, dedicated to the wide variety of humanoids who might be found on a spaceship, or the fringe planets it may visit. Filled with Captains, Mechanics, Doctors, Security Officers, Cooks, Aliens, Hackers, and others. Great for use with games such as Traveller, Starfinder, Firefly, and others!

boardgame.name: Motor Speed
boardgame.description:
Motor Speed is a somewhat more complex take on the idea of Racetrack. Instead of drawing lines, players move tokens representing cars on a square grid track.

As in Racetrack cars use vector movement and can generally only alter each component of the vector (horizontal and vertical) by one space a turn. However, cars have wear points and can expend these for extra changes to movement: half a point per extra acceleration and a point per extra deceleration.

Four different cars are provided with different characteristics.

If playing multiple laps pit stops may be made to replenish wear points.

boardgame.name: Spell Effects - 5E Wizard
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Spell Effects - 5E Wizard is the quintessential spell effects pack! Fireball, Lightning Bolt, Web, Cone of Cold, Burning Hands, and much much more!

Double-sided printing on transparent plastic, with graphics on one side, and helpful notes on the other to remind you of damage codes, saving throws, and other key details, and designed specifically for your game edition.

This 4 sheet kit will covers almost every spell you'll ever need for your Wizard, and most spells in general. A fantastic aide for both player and GM.

Includes 24 area spells, an additional 40 tokens, and a rangefinder.

boardgame.name: Spell Effects - 5E Bard
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Spell Effects - 5E Bard is the ultimate pack for the Bard at your table! Boasting a template for every basic shape, including a cone, 20’ radius, 15’ radius, 10’ radius, 5’ radius, 10’ square, 15’ square, and 20’ square, the 5E Bard has their full range of spells covered, and these templates can be used for any spell caster as well. Also includes a myriad of icons, to be used as buff markers, bardic inspiration reminders, Polymorph tokens, and other helpful aids.

Double-sided printing on transparent plastic, with graphics on one side, and helpful notes on the other to remind you of damage codes, saving throws, and other key details, and designed specifically for your game edition.

This 2 sheet kit will covers almost every spell you'll ever need for your Bard, and most spells in general. A fantastic aide for both player and GM.

Includes 10 area spells, an additional 36 tokens.

boardgame.name: Spell Effects - 5E Cleric
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Spell Effects - 5E Cleric is a massive set of spell effects, filled with traditional Cleric spells (and those spells accessed by their domains!) making it our biggest pack.

This 5 sheet kit will covers almost every spell you'll ever need for your Cleric, and most spells in general. A fantastic aide for both player and GM. Necessities like Guardian Spirits, Faerie Fire, Blade Barrier, and your Holy Aura are covered in perfect detail, along with many others like Spike Growth, Insect Plague and your traditional Fireball. (total list below)

Double-sided printing on transparent plastic, with graphics on one side, and helpful notes on the other to remind you of damage codes, saving throws, and other key details, and designed specifically for your game edition.

Shapes include 50-100' long beams, 15' cone, 10' Cube, 15' Cube, 20' Cube, 10' Radius, 15' Radius, 20' Radius, 30' Radius, 60x10' Rectangle.

Includes 19 area effects, an additional 92 tokens, and a rangefinder.

boardgame.name: Spell Effects - 5E Druid
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Spell Effects - 5E Druid is a perfect spell effects pack for druids of all shapes and sizes! Includes classic spells like Faerie Fire, Entangle, Darkness, Moonbeam, and Call Lightning, but also includes animal summoning tokens and 1", 2", and even 3" tokens for Wild Shape and Polymorph too!

Double-sided printing on transparent plastic, with graphics on one side, and helpful notes on the other to remind you of damage codes, saving throws, and other key details, and designed specifically for your game edition.

This 3 sheet kit will covers almost every spell you'll ever need for your Druid. A fantastic aide for both player and GM.

Includes 18 area spells, an additional 25 tokens, and a rangefinder.

boardgame.name: Spell Effects - PF Wizard
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Spell Effects - PF Wizard is the quintessential spell effects pack! Fireball, Lightning Bolt, Cone of Cold, Wall of Fire, Darkness, Fog Cloud, Fear, Sleep, and much much more!

Comes in 2 versions; a PFS version with correct corners, and a rounded 'natural shapes' version.

Cone spells in the PFS version show both casting directions, using the spell graphic, and a tracer.

Double-sided printing on transparent plastic, with graphics on one side, and helpful notes on the other to remind you of damage codes, saving throws, and other key details. and designed specifically for your game edition.

This 4 sheet kit will covers almost every spell you'll ever need for your Wizard, and most spells in general. A fantastic aide for both player and GM.

Includes 13 area spells, an additional 35 buff tokens, a rangefinder, medium and large summoned monster / polymorph tokens.
